page.title: 04CLUBS AND SOCIETIES.
page.content: This block is served bu active Women's Institutes, sports clubs and clubs based on the churches. Both Ripley and Pyrford have Scouts, Guides, Cubs and Brownies. Ripley has a British Legion, founded in 1921. There is a Garden & Allotment Society and (with a nearby village) a local History Society. Ripley and Pyrford have over-sixties clubs. The Ockham & Pyrford residents groups guard conservation and amenities and a school for the handicapped is helped by the Physically Handicapped Able-Bodied Society. Alcoholics Anonymous meets weekly in Ockham. Local facilities are good, e.g. cricket fields, village halls. Pyrford has a successful Youth Club offering a wide range of activities. Its premises are rented by a badminton club and by a lunch club for the house bound.
